image_rotation.cnn package¶

Submodules¶

image_rotation.cnn.predict module¶

image_rotation.cnn.predict.predict_orientation(model: object, image_path: str, threshold: float) → int¶

Predicts and returns the orientation of a ticket image. Predicts 0 (good orientation) by default except if the model detects another orientation with a probability superior to the threshold given as parameter.

Parameters

  • model (Keras model instance) – Keras model to be used for the prediction

  • image_path (str) – path to the image

  • threshold (float) – threshold between 0-1

Returns

orientation prediction (0, 90, 180 or 270)

Return type

int

image_rotation.cnn.prepare_database module¶

image_rotation.cnn.prepare_functions module¶

image_rotation.cnn.prepare_functions.prepare_1_image(file: str, resolution: int, filename: str, out_folder: str)¶

Resizes an image, add padds to get a square image, rotates it 3 times, and adds blurring and noise to get 12 images that can be used to train a model.

Parameters

  • file (str) – path to the original image

  • resolution (int) – width/height of the output images in pixels

  • filename (str) – filename base of the processed images

  • out_folder (str) – path to the folder to upload the 12 processed images

image_rotation.cnn.prepare_functions.prepare_testing_images(resolution: int, in_folder: str, out_folder: str) → tuple¶

Resizes and adds pads to the image files in a folder and turns some of them to obtain a balanced dataset that can be used to test a model. The N images in the original folder must all be in the normal orientation. The N processed images in the output folder are squared with the desired resolution, and rotated at 0, 90, 180, or 270 degrees. The last 3 characters of the file names indicate the orientation : ‘000’,’090’, ‘180’ or ‘270’.

Parameters

  • resolution (int) – width/height of the output images in pixels

  • in_folder (str) – path to the folder with original images

  • out_folder (str) – path to the folder to upload the processed images

Returns

a Tuple with the number of images uploaded and a List of the files that were not processed

Return type

(int, List of str)

image_rotation.cnn.prepare_functions.prepare_training_images(resolution: int, in_folder: str, out_folder: str) → tuple¶

Uses all image files in a folder to get 12 images / file that can be used to train a model. The N images in the original folder must all be in the normal orientation. The 12xN processed images in the output folder are squared with the desired resolution, rotated in 4 orientations (0, 90, 180, and 270 degrees) and with additional noise or blurring. The last 3 characters of the file names indicate the orientation : ‘000’,’090’, ‘180’ or ‘270’.

Parameters

  • resolution (int) – width/height of the output images in pixels

  • in_folder (str) – path to the folder with original images

  • out_folder (str) – path to the folder to upload the processed images

Returns

a Tuple with the number of images uploaded and a List of the files that were not processed

Return type

(int, List of str)
